The Mino area is renowned for its ceramics and Tajimi is no exception.  You can see several examples of the famous green pottery of Mino at the many museums and cultural centers around town.  This is a smaller city and makes for a nice break from the hectic life of major cities.
You can take the Chuo line heading towards Nakatsugawa from
.  The trip takes about 45 minutes.  This is the easiest and quickest way into the city.
Unfortunately Tajimi doesn't have a very good public transportation system.  There are buses, but they can be inconvenient.  The best way around this city is by car or taxi.

A very good place to see the fall colors and the cherry blossoms.  The main attraction is the small bridge over a pond.  It makes for some very picturesque views. There is free parking for the temple near the Chuo line train tracks, at GPS coordinates +35.348983, +137.129114. (As of October 2010, some surrounding temples are undergoing construction. The main temple is still accessible, but two of the four paths to the temple are closed for walking.)
